intro: Eriocephala grossei, commonly known as the roughhead eriocephala, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are generally rough and hairy, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense heads. Eriocephala grossei is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
